verses.roman:
dui-dui jane meli' kare jala-raṇa
keha hāre, keha jine-prabhu kare daraśana

synonyms: dui-dui jane—forming a party of two men; meli'-joining; kare—do; jala-raṇa—fighting in the water; keha hāre—someone is defeated; keha jine—someone is victorious; prabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; kare daraśana—sees.
translation: Sometimes two would pair off to fight in the water. One would emerge victorious and the other defeated, and the Lord would watch all this fun.
